title: Two suspects arrested for aiding and abetting Dehiwala and Kohuwala shootings
byline: Two suspects have been arrested by the Western Province South Crime Division in connection with two shootings that occurred in the Dehiwala and Kohuwala areas.

title: Musk’s SpaceX applies to launch 1m satellites into orbit
byline: Elon Musk’s SpaceX has applied to launch one million satellites into Earth’s orbit to power artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Asgiri Anunayaka Thero raises concerns over declining recognition of Maha Sangha, culture and history
byline: The Anunayaka Thero of the Asgiri Chapter, Venerable Wedaruwe Upali Thero, stated that there is widespread concern at present over the lack of proper recognition given to the Maha Sangha, culture, and history.

title: 14 arrested for stealing ancient Buddha statue in Kahapathwala
byline: Mawathagama Police have arrested 14 suspects in connection with the theft of a Buddha statue of ancient value from a temple in Kahapathwala.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers will occur at times in Northern, North-Central and Eastern provinces and in Matale and Nuwara Eliya districts, today (01), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Traders oppose govt. move to transfer economic centres to new company
byline: Owners of economic centre trade stalls have informed the Minister of Trade, Commerce, Food Security and Cooperative Development, Wasantha Samarasinghe, that they strongly oppose the government’s decision to transfer five of the country’s leading economic centres from their current administrative structure to a new establishment.

title: Pakistan says 92 militants killed after attacks in Balochistan
byline: At least 92 militants were killed on Saturday battling Pakistan’s security forces in multiple cities across the southwestern province of Balochistan, Pakistan’s military said.

title: PM Modi meets Arab leaders, says India backs Palestinians, Gaza peace plan
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who met the foreign ministers of Arab nations in New Delhi for the second India-Arab Foreign Ministers’ Meeting on Saturday, reiterated India’s “continued support” for the Palestinians and US President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan.

title: Dy Minister outlines govt measures to rebuild industries affected by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: Deputy Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Chathuranga Abeysinghe has stated that the government is taking measures to provide the necessary support to rebuild industries devastated by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Education system must be transformed to align with demands of modern world – PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that in order to ensure the economic, social, and cultural security of the country, it is essential to develop quality human resources, and that education plays a vital role in achieving this goal.

title: GMOA to convene special Executive Committee meeting
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that it will hold a special Executive Committee meeting today (31) to decide on future actions in relation to its unresolved issues.

title: Aviation Minister explains reason for removal of AASL chairman
byline: Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation, Anura Karunathilaka, has stated that the removal of Harsha Abeywickrama from the position of Chairman of Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited (AASL) was part of necessary administrative structural changes within the company.

title: President extends declaration of essential services following Cyclone Ditwah
byline: In response to the ongoing post-disaster situation caused by Cyclone Ditwah, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has extended the declaration of certain services as essential public services under the Essential Public Services Act, No. 61 of 1979.

title: Opposition Leader Sajith meets school dev. officers on hunger strike
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa had arrived this morning (31) at the site of the fast-unto-death protest launched by the School Development Officers’ Association, which is demanding their immediate integration into the teaching service.

title: Eight high-ranking police officers including DIGs transferred
byline: Eight high-ranking police officers have been transferred with immediate effect, subject to the approval of the National Police Commission (NPC).

title: 3.6 magnitude tremor reported off Mullaitivu coast
byline: A minor earth tremor measuring 3.6 in the Richter Scale has been recorded in the sea area off Mullaitivu, the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau said.

title: Coastal line train delays expected today and tomorrow – Railway Dept
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced that trains operating on the Coastal Line between Colombo Fort and Wellawatte railway stations may experience delays of about 15 minutes today (31) and tomorrow (01) due to essential maintenance work to upgrade the signaling system.

title: Two explosions reported in Iran - as Israel denies involvement
byline: Two explosions have been reported in Iran as the regime denied a ‌military leader was targeted, amid heightened tension in the region.

title: Armed extremists kill dozens in northeastern Nigeria
byline: Armed extremists in northeastern Nigeria killed dozens of people earlier this week in separate attacks targeting a construction site and a military installation, security officials said Saturday.

title: More than 200 killed in coltan mine collapse in east Congo, official says
byline: More than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday.

title: UN risks ‘imminent financial collapse’, secretary general warns
byline: The United Nations is at risk of “imminent financial collapse” due to member states not paying their fees, the body’s head has warned.

title: Fuel prices revised
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (31).

title: Sri Lankans in Israel urged to remain vigilant amid rising tensions – Embassy
byline: The Sri Lankan Embassy in Israel has advised Sri Lankan nationals residing in Israel to remain vigilant in light of escalating security developments across the Middle East.

title: Epstein files records released by US DoJ claims Bill Gates had extramarital affairs
byline: The United States Department of Justice on Friday released emails in which the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein claimed that Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates had engaged in extramarital sex.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces, and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Modi ally proposes social media ban for India’s teens as global debate grows
byline: An ally of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has proposed a bill to ban social media for children, as the world’s biggest market for Meta and YouTube joins a global debate on the impact of social media on young people’s health and safety.

title: US government partially shuts down despite last minute funding deal
byline: The United States federal government has partially shutdown despite a last-ditch funding deal approved by the US Senate.

title: GMOA to intensify trade union action from Monday
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has decided to intensify its ongoing continuous trade union action from February 2 (Monday), following a lack of response from relevant authorizes regarding several of their key demands.

title: Father kills teenage daughter with sharp weapon over mobile phone dispute
byline: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly killed by her father with a sharp weapon following a dispute over a mobile phone last night (30), according to police.

title: Indonesia landslide death toll rises to 49, agency says
byline: The death toll from a landslide a week ago in Indonesia’s West Java province has risen to 49, the country’s main rescue agency Basarnas said on Saturday, with 15 still missing.

title: India sends 10 more Bailey bridges to Sri Lanka to assist reconstruction
byline: As reconstruction efforts continue in the wake of cyclone Ditwah, India dispatched a consignment of 10 Bailey bridges to Colombo onboard INS Gharial to assist the restoration of critical connectivity.

title: Pokémon cancels event at controversial Japan shrine following backlash
byline: A Pokémon card game event at a shrine honouring Japan’s war dead has been cancelled following a backlash in China.

title: India allocates INR 4 billion in aid to Sri Lanka in 2026 Budget
byline: The Government of India has proposed a total of 4 billion Indian Rupees in aid to Sri Lanka through the 2026 Budget.

title: Gazette issued extending declaration of several services including electricity supply as essential service
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has issued an extraordinary gazette notification extending the declaration of a number of services, including the supply of electricity and fuel, as essential services.

title: Israeli air strikes kill at least 32 Palestinians in Gaza
byline: At least 32 people have been killed in a wave of Israeli air strikes across the Gaza Strip on Saturday, according to local authorities.

title: Shiranthi Rajapaksa summoned to FCID on Tuesday; CID summons Namal
byline: Shiranthi Rajapaksa, the wife of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been instructed to appear before the Police Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) on Tuesday (03).

title: State of Public Emergency in Sri Lanka extended
byline: The State of Public Emergency in Sri Lanka has been extended.

title: Advisory issued for severe lightning
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for severe lightning in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle and Matara districts. M0RE..

title: Duo arrested with over 5kg of heroin in Bentota
byline: Police have arrested two individuals for the possession of 5 kilograms and 105 grams of heroin during a special operation in Bentota.

title: Strike launched by Development Officers opposite Presidential Secretariat enters day seven
byline: The strike launched by a group of Development Officers opposite the Presidential Secretariat enters day seven today.

title: Private operators demand bus fare hike amidst rising operational costs
byline: Bus fares will have to be increased in the coming months, despite a recent marginal reduction in fuel prices, the President of the Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA), Gemunu Wijeratne has stated.

title: India raises infrastructure spending to record 12.2 trillion rupees for 2026-27
byline: India’s federal government will spend a record 12.2 trillion rupees ($133.08 billion) on infrastructure in the upcoming financial year that begins on April 1, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said during her annual budget presentation on Sunday.

title: 22-year old arrested with nearly 500g of ‘Ice’ in Aluthgama
byline: An individual has been arrested while behaving suspiciously near the Aluthgama Railway Station by the Kalutara Crimes Division.

title: Gerardo Taracena, ‘Apocalypto’ actor and renowned Mexican performer, dies at 55
byline: Gerardo Taracena, a celebrated Mexican actor and dancer known for Apocalypto and other projects, died on 31 January 2026 at the age of 55.

title: India allocates INR 4 billion in grants and loans to Sri Lanka in 2026 Budget
byline: The Government of India has proposed a total of 4 billion Indian Rupees in grants and loans to Sri Lanka through the 2026/27 Budget.

title: Man nabbed for stealing mobile phone of Russian woman in Unawatuna
byline: An individual has been arrested for stealing a mobile phone worth nearly Rs. 300,000 belonging to a Russian national.

title: India budget ‘tactical’, not ‘breakthrough’, Moody’s Ratings says
byline: India’s annual federal budget was “tactical” but not a “breakthrough”, Moody’s Ratings said in its reaction to a government roadmap for the next financial year.

title: Body of newborn found floating in Nuwara Eliya Gregory Lake
byline: The body of a newborn baby has been found floating in Gregory Lake in Nuwara Eliya today (01), according to the Nuwara Eliya Police.

title: Iran’s supreme leader warns any US attack would spark ‘regional war’
byline: Iran’s supreme leader warned Sunday that any attack by the United States would spark a ‘regional war’ in the Mideast, further escalating tensions as President Donald Trump has threatened to militarily strike the Islamic Republic over its crackdown on recent nationwide protests.

title: Riverston reopens for tourists
byline: The Riverston Tourist Zone in the Knuckles Forest Reserve, a designated World Heritage area has reopened to local and international visitors today (01), after it was closed owing to damages caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Five injured in road accident in Anuradhapura
byline: At least five individuals have sustained injuries in an accident reported at the Galkulama police road barrier in Anuradhapura this morning, police stated.

title: Gazette issued amending regulations on night shift hours for female workers
byline: A Gazette notification has been issued granting permission to employ women as sanitary workers and food service attendants during night-time hours.

title: Israel to expel Doctors Without Borders from Gaza
byline: Israel announced on Sunday it would bar the humanitarian organization Doctors Without Borders from operating in the Gaza Strip after the group refused to hand over a list of its Palestinian staff.

title: Ginger prices soar amid supply shortage
byline: Prices of ginger in the local market have surged sharply, according to vegetable traders in Hatton.

title: Driver prevents bus from plunging over 50-foot cliff in Walapane
byline: A bus heading from Nildandhahinna to Teripaha in Walapane today (01) narrowly avoided disaster when its driver managed to stop the vehicle just before it could tumble over a 50-foot cliff.

title: Health Ministry to intervene to resolve issues faced by children of GMOA members during school admissions
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media has decided to intervene to resolve issues faced by children of members of Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) during school admissions.

title: Four arrested for assaulting police officers during drug raid in Maha Oya
byline: Four individuals have been arrested by the Maha Oya Police on charges of assaulting police officers who were conducting a drug raid.

title: Sixth Development Officer on hunger strike hospitalized
byline: Another Development Officer who was staging a hunger strike opposite the Presidential Secretariat has been hospitalized.

title: Police open fire at lorry in Kilinochchi after driver ignores orders
byline: Police opened fire at a lorry in Tharmapuram, Kilinochchi after the driver continued to drive without complying with police orders.

title: Pakistan to boycott T20 World Cup match against India
byline: Pakistan will boycott their game against India at the 2026 T20 World Cup.

title: Pakistan says 145 ‘Indian-backed terrorists’ killed in Balochistan after deadly attacks
byline: Pakistani police and military forces killed over a 100 “Indian-backed terrorists “ in counterterrorism operations across the restive southwestern province of Balochistan over the past 40 hours, government officials said on Sunday, a day after coordinated suicide and gun attacks killed 33 people, mostly civilians.

title: Health Ministry to resolve issues faced by transferred doctors when enrolling children into schools
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media has decided to intervene to resolve issues faced by doctors who have been transferred, during the admission of their children into new schools.

title: Association of Medical Specialists not joining doctors’ union action
byline: The Association of Medical Specialists (AMS) says that none of its members will engage in the trade union action to be staged by doctors from tomorrow.
